question.name: 4.5.1.3 Continuation
question.questiontext: Using \(x = R \cos \omega t\) this 'to and fro' or 'vibrational' or 'oscillatory' motion between \(R\) and \(-R\)  continues indefinitely.  The technical name for this motion is  simple harmonic.  To a good approximation it is the motion exhibited (i) by the end of a pendulum pulled through a small angle and then released (ii) by the end of a hanging spring pulled down and then released.
